title: TRGC1 and TRGC2
text:
TRGC1: T Cell Receptor Gamma Constant 1 TRGC2: T cell Receptor Gamma Constant 2
TRGC1 has an important paralog called TRGC2.
(A paralog is a gene that shares a common ancestry with another gene within the same organism.)



Elephant


Source: https://www.nature.com/articles/cmi201528/figures/1

title: About the site
text: To gather notes on learning bioinformatics and immunology & oncology.

title: sequencing requirement
text:
Dual index
Customers need to order additional index and primers. Index and primers go hand in hand?
8 lanes: Customers can order 4 i7 and do single index
The diversity of the index also follows the rule. Low diversity leads to low sequencing quality in index.
Reverse Primer 1 - 4: Name is Nextera, but the backbone is TrueSeq. So, it’s important to use TrueSeq chemistry.

title: visualization_umap_ridge
text: UMAP visualization sometimes doesn’t give the complete picture. Couple with Ridge (log10 or no log10) to draw a conclusion.

title: Extract genomic regions of interest
text:
This is an example about how to extract genomic regions of interest and put those sequences in a fasta file.
We will use the software SnapGene.
Firstly, download SnapGene. A free version is enough to cover this example.
https://www.snapgene.com/
Secondly, download your transcript of interest from NCBI. Please note that
